name: Mama "Julie" Comba
biographical_notes: An African woman of the Mandinga nation who lived in the Hospital for the Poor (L'Hôpital des Pauvres) and was enslaved to the Capuchin priests; questioned in the case of Louis dit Foÿ.

name: Louis dit Foÿ
biographical_notes: Lived in Saint Domingue and the Illinois Country before arriving in Louisiana. He was enslaved to Sr. Duplessis in Saint Domingue, sent from Le Cap to Sieur Gaillardy, sold by Gaillardy to Sieur Blevins of Illinois Country.
document_descriptions: Self-identifies his age, biographical information (including enslavers in Saint-Domingue and the Illinois Country) and nation in his testimony.

name: Louison (Cantrelle)
biographical_notes: Lived in a cabin in the garden of her enslaver, Cantrelle.

name: Cézar (Jung)
biographical_notes: Friend of Louis dit Foÿ; enslaved by Jung, Lieutenant of the Police.
document_descriptions: Self-identifies his age and as being "Creolle de nation."

name: Fatima (de Lafrenière)
biographical_notes: Enslaved to de Lafrenière.

name: "une autre négress"
biographical_notes: Friend of Louison (Cantrelle) and Cézar (Jung).

name: unnamed "négresse" (Baschemin)
biographical_notes: Enslaved to Baschemin.

name: Biron (Soubaigne)
biographical_notes: Arrived in Louisiana on the ship "Aurore"; does not speak French; enslaved to Jean Soubaigne.

name: Louis Congo
biographical_notes: Promised his freedom in 1725 by colonial administrators in exchange for his role as High Executioner; husband of Suzanne.

name: Charlotte (Meuillion)
biographical_notes: Mother of Louis and Helene; enslaved to Antoine Meullion, surgeon residing at Pointe Coupée.

name: Louis (Meuillion)
biographical_notes: Son of Charlotte; brother of Helene.

name: Helene (Meuillion)
biographical_notes: Daughter of Charlotte; sister of Louis.

name: Pierrot (Brosset)
biographical_notes: Enslaved by Michèl Brosset; sold by Claude Boisson and his wife, Magdelaine Chenier.

name: Samba Bambara
biographical_notes: Interpreter for the Superior Council; described as Christian.

name: Naneta St. Marc
biographical_notes: Sister of Juan Pedro alias Bonhomme; from the Attakapas Post.

name: Juan Pedro alias Bonhomme (Prevot)
biographical_notes: Brother of Naneta St. Marc; enslaved by Salomon Prevot; injured when a small shack, or "choza," fell on him during a hurricane prior to 1793.

name: Louis (Mouton)
biographical_notes: Enslaved to Catherine Mouton, the Widow Bonvillian.

name: Maria Juana
biographical_notes: Negre libre, vendor of stall on Ursulines; friend of Genoveva Junon.

name: unnamed "négresse" (de Chavannes)
biographical_notes: Enslaved to Jean-Baptiste de Chavannes beginning in 1722-1723; before that enslaved to de Gauvrit who purchased her from the Company of the Indies; forced upriver by Chavannes to his plantation near the village of the Petits Collas (Acolapissa).

name: Genoveva Junon
biographical_notes: Negra libre, homeowner in the City of New Orleans; associate of Maria Juana, negra libre.

name: Naneta Boré
biographical_notes: Mulata libre, friend of Maturine (Boré).

name: unnamed "nègre" (Soubaigne)
biographical_notes: Lived on the plantation of Jean Soubaigne in Gentilly.

name: Angelica (Ramis)
biographical_notes: Grandmother to Maria Antonia (Porta); this suit follows Angelica's legal proceedings as she goes before the New Orleans Cabildo to initiate coartación proceedings for her 4-year old granddaughter, Maria Antonia, so that she may purchase her freedom.

name: Maria Antonia (Porta)
biographical_notes: 4-year old granddaughter of Angelica (Ramis), enslaved by Santiago Porta; is granted freedom after her grandmother, Angelica, successfully pursues her coartación.

name: Catharina (Destrehan)
biographical_notes: Catharina, mulata esclava, belonging to the estate of Don Juan Bautista Destrehan, which is administered by Étienne de Boré; mother of Felicité; enslaved on the Destrehan Plantation.

name: Julia Fortier
biographical_notes: Negra libre, resident of the City of New Orleans, files a freedom suit on behalf of Medery (Picquery).

name: Felicité (Destrehan)
biographical_notes: Daughter of Catharina; enslaved on the Destrehan Plantation.

name: Medery (Picquery)
biographical_notes: Friend of Julia Fortier; enslaved by Antoine Joseph Picquery.

name: Bontemps (Pellerin)
biographical_notes: Unnamed in this document, Bontemps was identified at his 1728 trial as being one of Louis Congo's attackers.

name: Guillory (Trudeau)
biographical_notes: Unnamed in this document, Guillory was identified at his 1728 trial as being one of Louis Congo's attackers.

name: unnamed "sauvage déserteur"
biographical_notes: Unnamed in this document, one of "trois sauvages déserteurs," was accused alongside Bontemps and Guillory in the attack of Louis Congo.

name: unnamed "esclave" (Saint-Martin)
biographical_notes: Unnamed in this document, accused of assisting Indigenous maroons and stealing weapons from Saint-Martin.

name: Maturine (Boré)
biographical_notes: Enslaved by Alexandro Boré; friend of Naneta; accused of having done nothing worthy of her freedom.

name: Mariana Marcos alias Voisin
biographical_notes: Negra libre, sister of Pelagia (D'Anneville); associate of Francisco Ramón Canes, "el Curro."

name: Pelagia (D'Anneville)
biographical_notes: Negra esclava, sister to Mariana Marcos alias Voisin; enslaved by Pierre Olivier D'Anneville.

name: Francisco Ramón Canes alias el Curro
biographical_notes: Associate of Marina Marcos alias Voisin; helped in the coartación of Pelagia (D'Anneville).

name: Cecilia Tounoir
biographical_notes: Afro-Indigenous woman, aunt to Naneta (Tounoir); previously enslaved by Juan Bautista Tounoir; daughter of María of the Patouca nation; sister to Maria Juana (Monsanto); aunt to Marie (Poydras) and Antoine Sarrazin (Poydras), conspirator of the Pointe Coupée Uprising of 1795.

name: Naneta (Tounoir)
biographical_notes: Niece of Cecilia, enslaved by by Juan Bautista Tounoir; granddaughter of María of the Patouca nation; most likely Afro-Indigenous.

name: María (Germain)
biographical_notes: Mother of Cecilia Tounoir and Maria Juana (Monsanto); grandmother of Naneta (Tounoir), Marie (Poydras), and Antoine Sarrazin (Poydras); enslaved Indigenous woman of the Patouca nation, Plains Apache.

name: Roseta Montreuil
biographical_notes: Mother of Domingo alias Lubin (Montreuil), formerly enslaved by Roberto Montreuil.

name: Maria (Pery)
biographical_notes: Mother of Maria (Richard), cimarrona.

name: Maria of Kabahan Nossée (Richard)
biographical_notes: Daughter of Maria (Pery), enslaved by Juan Bautista Richard at Kabahan Nossée (Acadian Coast) near Manchac.

name: Domingo alias Lubin (Montreuil)
biographical_notes: Son of Roseta Montreuil, enslaved by Roberto Montreuil.
